summary: This document is an email chain from July 12, 2019, between an FBI agent and a former FBI agent. The former agent is referring a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein to the FBI. The victim is described as credible, possessing information about the trafficking process, specifics on high-level government people, and names of other victims. The email also mentions a deceased retired female cop who was working on human trafficking and a murdered Arkansas state senator.

persons.name: Linda Collins Smith
persons.context: Mentioned as having had contact with the email sender about a CPS corruption case and possessing information on child trafficking; noted as now deceased (murdered).

events.title: Referral of Potential Epstein Victim to FBI
events.description: A former FBI agent emails an active FBI agent to refer a credible male victim who has information on Epstein's trafficking process, high-level government individuals, and names of other victims.

events.title: Murder of Linda Collins Smith
events.description: The email mentions that Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins Smith was murdered; she had information on child trafficking and the FBI is believed to be working her murder case.

keyFacts: A former FBI agent is referring a credible male victim to the FBI who has information aligning with the Epstein case, including details on the trafficking process and high-level government people.
The potential victim is reported to have information about 'one former president' in the context of the abuse.
The referral mentions a deceased retired female cop who was previously working on human trafficking with an investigative journalist friend.
The email also references contact with the now-murdered Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who had information on child trafficking.
The communication shows an informal channel (former agent to active agent) being used to route a sensitive victim tip to the FBI's Epstein investigation team.
